Detailed Description

MCompositeWindowShaderEffect is the base class for shader effects on windows.

Shader effects can change the appearance of composited windows by hooking into the rendering pipeline of the compositor. It allows manipulation of how a composited window is rendered by using custom GLSL fragment shaders and direct access to the texture rendering function. An effect can be disabled by calling setEnabled(false). If effects are disabled, the window texture is rendered directly.

To add special effects to composited windows, subclass MCompositeWindowShaderEffect and reimplement the pure virtual function drawTexture()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Creates a window effect object

MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::~MCompositeWindowShaderEffect (  )  [virtual]

Destroys the graphics effect and deletes GLSL fragment programs from the compositor's rendering engine if any are installed from this effect

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::drawSource ( const QTransform &  transform,
const QRectF &  drawRect,
qreal  opacity,
bool  texcoords_from_rect = false 
) [protected]

Draws currently bound source window texture. Specify a transformation matrix to transform and texture geometry to drawRect. Opacity can be set by specifying opacity (0.0 - 1.0). This function should only be called inside drawTexture()

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::drawSource ( const QTransform &  transform,
const QRectF &  drawRect,
qreal  opacity,
const GLvoid *  texCoords 
) [protected]

Draws currently bound source window texture. Specify a transformation matrix to transform and texture geometry to drawRect. Opacity can be set by specifying opacity (0.0 - 1.0). texCoords specifies custom texture coordinates. This function should only be called inside drawTexture()

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::drawTexture ( const QTransform &  transform,
const QRectF &  drawRect,
qreal  opacity 
) [protected, pure virtual]

This pure virtual function is called whenever the windows texture is rendered. Reimplement it to completely customize how the texture of this window is rendered using the given transformation matrix transform, texture geometry drawRect, and opacity.

Implemented in MStatusBarCrop.

bool MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::enabled (  )  const
Returns:
Whether this effect is enabled or not
void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::enabledChanged ( bool  enabled  )  [signal]

Emmitted if this effect gets disabled or enabled

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::installEffect ( MCompositeWindow *  window  )  [virtual]

Install this effect on a composite window object window. Note that we override QGraphicsItem::setGraphicsEffect() because we have a completely different painting engine. If a window has a previous effect, it will be overriden by the new one

GLuint MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::installShaderFragment ( const QByteArray &  code  ) 

Adds and installs the source code for a pixel shader fragment to code.

The code must define a GLSL function with the signature {lowp vec4 customShader(lowp sampler2D imageTexture, highp vec2 textureCoords)} that returns the source pixel value to use in the paint engine's shader program. The following is the default pixel shader fragment, which draws a texture with no effect applied:

  lowp vec4 customShader(lowp sampler2D imageTexture, highp vec2 textureCoords)
  {
      return texture2D(imageTexture, textureCoords);
  }
Returns:
The id of the fragment shader. If the fragment shader is invalid, return 0.
See also:
setUniforms()
void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::removeEffect ( MCompositeWindow *  window  ) 

Remove this effect from a composite window object window. After removing the effect the window will use default shaders.

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::setActiveShaderFragment ( GLuint  id  ) 

Sets the rendering pipeline to use shader fragment specified by id

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::setEnabled ( bool  enabled  )  [slot]

Enable or disable this effect

void MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::setUniforms ( QGLShaderProgram *  program  )  [protected, virtual]

Set the uniform values on the currently active shader program. Default implementation does nothing. Reimplement this function to set values if you specified a custom pixel shader in your effects.

GLuint MCompositeWindowShaderEffect::texture (  )  const
Returns:
Texture id of the currently rendered window
